Melbourne's food trucks have set a high standard, but the Revenge of the Curds falls woefully short. Save your money and your taste buds, and seek out a more deserving vendor.

The King Combo, Greek Salad, and beverages I ordered were far from king-worthy. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the salad was limp and unappetizing, and the bottled water and soda were lukewarm. The service was unfriendly, and the overall experience was a disaster. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's menu offerings, ranging from burritos to tacos, were met with enthusiastic approval. The chicken burrito, with its succulent chicken, fresh toppings, and flavorful guac, was a standout favorite. The two taco combo plate, featuring crispy tacos with generous fillings, was equally satisfying. The lean burrito bowl, brimming with fresh vegetables and a lean protein option, was a healthy and flavorful choice. The veggie taco bowl, showcasing a medley of fresh vegetables and a crunchy shell, was met with praise for its unique and creative composition. Overall, the Guac n' Roll truck's menu caters to a diverse range of tastes, providing a satisfying culinary experience for all.

The "Better Off Bread" truck's Italian sandwich was an utter disappointment. The bread was soggy, the meat was dry and overcooked, and the cheese was sparse. The sandwich was not overflowing with flavor as I had hoped, leaving me feeling unfulfilled. The hot ham and cheese sandwich was equally unappetizing, with bland ham and plasticky cheese. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Le Coin des Crêpes truck in Sao Paulo is a hidden gem! The crepes were absolutely delightful. The Breakfast Crepe was a perfect blend of savory and sweet, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a unique twist on a classic comfort food. The quality of ingredients was top-notch, and the service was friendly and efficient. I highly recommend this food truck to anyone looking for a delicious and satisfying meal. You won't be disappointed!

Nani's Kitchen delivered a delightful Indian feast to my Sao Paulo home. The combination curry was a generous portion filled with tender chicken and flavorful vegetables. The lean chicken tikka masala was perfectly marinated and cooked, with tender chicken and a creamy tikka sauce. The bottled soda was a refreshing accompaniment to the spicy dishes. Overall, the food was authentic, flavorful, and satisfying. I highly recommend Nani's Kitchen for anyone seeking a taste of India in Sao Paulo.

The Cheeky Greek truck's gyros are simply divine. The meat is tender and flavorful, and the toppings are fresh and crisp. The Greek salad is a perfect side dish, with its tangy olives and fresh lettuce. The bottled soda and ice tea are refreshing and quenching. Overall, I couldn't be happier with my order. The food is delicious, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is casual and relaxed. I highly recommend checking out Cheeky Greek if you're looking for a tasty and authentic Greek experience in Seoul.

The Le Coin des Crêpes menu offered a delightful selection of crepes and accompanying items. The breakfast crepe was fluffy and flavorful, while the chicken pot pie crepe was a hearty and satisfying treat. The ice tea was refreshing and perfectly complements the sweet and savory offerings. Overall, the experience was pleasant and the food was well-prepared.

Lobster Mac & Cheese at The Mac Shack fell short of expectations. The lobster exhibited overcooked texture, BY absorbed complexity, turning tough and devoid of the delicate, succulent characteristics one craves. The cheese sauce lacked the promised rich, creamy taste, failing to deliver on the comforting flavors synonymous with mac & cheese. The presentation left much to be desired, arriving in an unadorned container, bereft of garnish or aesthetically pleasing embellishments. In sum, the dish was an underwhelming experience and did not justify the investment. I had anticipated more from an establishment called "The Mac Shack".

Disappointed with my experience at Tasty Tibs in Delhi. The Lean Beef Tibs, which should have been tender and flavorful, was dry and overcooked. The menu boasted of authentic Ethiopian spices, but the dish lacked that promised aromatic spirit. The service was also slow, which further dampened the dining experience. Despite being a fan of Ethiopian cuisine, this meal was a letdown. I had expected more from a place that claims to serve authentic meals. Unfortunately, Tasty Tibs did not live up to its name.

Revisiting Revenge of the Curds in New York City proved to be a delightful experience. The Classic poutine, with its flavorful and thick gravy, and perfectly crispy and gooey curds, did not disappoint. The accompanying ice tea was also a hit - refreshing and invigorating. Overall, the meal was satisfying and left a memorable impression. The Kitchen Sink, too, proved to be a tasty treat. Highly recommended for poutine and ice tea lovers alike.

Mac Shack in Paris successfully reimagines a beloved comfort food, Mac & Cheese, with their unique offerings. The Standard Mac & Cheese proves to be a reliable choice, delivering a creamy and satisfying experience reminiscent of the classic dish. However, the Lobster Mac & Cheese truly shines, boasting generous chunks of lobster that elevate the flavor profile to new heights. The Ice Tea served complements the meal well, providing a refreshing balance to the richness of the mac and cheese.Although the prices are on the higher side, the quality of ingredients and the exquisite taste make up for the cost. Overall, Mac Shack is a recommended destination for anyone looking to indulge in a gourmet version of this classic dish.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal from Cheeky Greek. The King Combo lacked the royal treatment, with gyro meat dry and flavorless. The accompanying Greek Salad was a letdown too, with wilted lettuce and barely any feta cheese. The Gyro Plate was no better, with the pita bread soggy and falling apart. Even the bottled water and soda failed to refresh, served at room temperature. Overall, a meal that didn't live up to its name or the expectations set by its menu type. Not recommended for those seeking an authentic Gyros experience in Mumbai.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Vancouver disappointed with its Three Meat Plate. The meat was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture that lacked any smoky flavor. The sides were bland and uninspiring, doing little to complement the main dish. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck. I expected more from a BBQ joint, and unfortunately, Smoky BBQ did not deliver.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Delhi dished out a satisfying meal comprising the King Combo, Greek Salad, and Gyro Plate. The gyro meat exhibited rich flavors and tenderness, but the pita bread lacked warmth. The Greek Salad was crisp and fresh, an excellent accompaniment to the main course. Generous portion sizes ensured excellent value for money. However, the service was sluggish, slightly marring the overall dining experience. In summary, the meal was decent, but there's potential for enhancing service speed and food temperature.

"Revenge of the Curds truly redefines the poutine experience in London. 'Mother's Favorite' was an absolute delight, a perfect blend of rich, creamy cheese curds and crispy fries, all smothered in a savory gravy. The 'Kitchen Sink' was a fun surprise, packed with a variety of toppings that created a symphony of flavors. The truck's commitment to quality and creativity shines through in every bite. A must-visit for poutine lovers!"

Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck, a gem for hot dog lovers in Seattle, is an absolute must-try. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog, among others, were all delectable choices. Each hot dog was grilled to perfection, accompanied by fresh, flavorful toppings, all nestled in soft, warm buns. The staff's friendliness and efficiency further enhanced the experience, with service being swift and smooth. In summary, a highly positive experience was had at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, making it a top recommendation for anyone on the hunt for an excellent hot dog in Seattle.

Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread in Rio de Janeiro: A delightful feast. Bread, fresh and pliable, enhanced the experience. Pastrami, flavorful and tender, was the star. Sandwich, well-constructed with crisp vegetables and ample cheese slice, completed the symphony. Thoroughly enjoyed this Pastrami sandwich at Better Off Bread and encourage others to try it.

Mega Melt, a food truck stationed in Toronto, provided a grilled cheese experience that met expectations. Their Original grilled cheese sandwich was competently made, striking a pleasant equilibrium between cheese and bread. However, it didn't distinctly outshine other grilled cheese options available in the city. The bottled soda served as a revitalizing complement to the meal, and the Ranch side offered a zesty counterpoint to the sandwich. In summary, the meal was acceptable, but it may not justify a dedicated journey.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was flavorful and satisfying. The lean chicken tikka masala was tender and marinated perfectly, while the combination curry was rich and aromatic. The bottled water and soda were refreshing and chilled. Overall, the meal was enjoyable and reasonably priced.

The Freezing Point truck in New York City offered a mixed experience. The Popsicles were refreshing, with a good balance of sweetness and fruitiness. However, they were smaller than expected. The Waffle Cones, on the other hand, were a highlight. They were fresh, crisp, and had a delightful buttery taste. The service was efficient, but the truck's location was a bit hard to find. Overall, it's a decent choice for a quick ice cream fix, but it might not meet all expectations.

Ice Cream truck's order summary in Seoul highlights a two scoop bowl, waffle cone, mango sticky rice, and ice cream sandwich. The menu type and location are clearly identified, and the order provides a good representation of the truck's menu. The summary is concise, with little room for interpretation or ambiguity.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Seoul is a hidden gem! The Rack of Pork Ribs was incredibly tender, with a perfect smoky flavor that left me craving more. The Two Meat Plate was equally delicious, offering a variety of flavors that complemented each other perfectly. The Bottled Water was a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. The BBQ menu is top-notch, and I highly recommend this truck to anyone looking for a fantastic BBQ experience in Seoul. The quality of the food and the friendly service made this a memorable dining experience. I'll definitely be back for more!

The Mac Shack's offerings fell short of expectations. The "Buffalo Mac & Cheese" was far too sweet, bordering on cloying, while the "Standard Mac & Cheese" lacked the creamy richness promised. The ice tea was tepid and unrefreshing, and the bottled soda was overpriced. While the lobster mac & cheese was flavorful, the portion size was diminutive. Overall, the food and drinks fell below par.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes were a mix of satisfying and underwhelming. The Breakfast Crepe was well-prepared, with a balanced filling that complemented the delicate crepe texture. However, the Crepe Suzette lacked the expected zest, falling slightly short of expectations. The Bottled Water and Ice Tea were standard, serving their purpose adequately. Overall, the experience was decent but could have been better with more consistency in the food quality.

The Mega Melt truck in Mumbai offered a satisfactory experience. The grilled cheese menu was appealing, with a good variety of options. The Ranch and Miss Piggie items were well-prepared, with a nice balance of flavors. The bottled water and soda were standard. The truck was clean and the service was efficient. However, there was nothing particularly outstanding about the experience. It was a solid choice for a quick meal, but it didn't necessarily stand out from other food trucks in the area.

"Tasty Tibs truly lives up to its name! The Lean Chicken Tibs I ordered was a culinary delight. The Ethiopian spices were perfectly balanced, giving the dish a unique and flavorful twist. The chicken was tender, juicy, and cooked to perfection. The service was prompt and the staff was friendly, making the experience even more enjoyable. If you're in Sao Paulo and craving Ethiopian cuisine, Tasty Tibs is a must-visit. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!"

"The Mac Shack truly elevates the mac and cheese experience. The Standard Mac & Cheese was creamy and delicious, a classic comfort food done right. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese added a delightful kick, offering a perfect blend of spice and cheesy goodness. Pairing these with their refreshing Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea made for a well-rounded meal. A must-visit in Paris for all mac and cheese enthusiasts!"

The "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace was a disappointing experience. The vegetables lacked freshness and the dressing was bland, failing to deliver the expected flavor explosion. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, considering the price. Overall, not the satisfying vegetarian meal I was hoping for in Warsaw.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck was an unmitigated disaster. The chicken was dry and stringy, hardly lean as promised. The injera was stale and rubbery, and the berbere sauce was far too sweet, drowning out any semblance of flavor from the chicken. I would not recommend this truck to anyone, especially those with discerning palates.

Disappointment was the main course at Tasty Tibs. The Ice Tea was overly sweet, lacking the refreshing balance one expects. The Lean Chicken and Beef Tibs, while flavorful, were tough and dry, far from the tender, juicy morsels Ethiopian cuisine is known for. The Veggie Combo, a hodgepodge of undercooked and overcooked vegetables, was a letdown. The Bottled Water, thankfully, was as expected. Overall, Tasty Tibs in Rio de Janeiro failed to deliver the Ethiopian culinary experience it promised.

Better Off Bread's Pastrami sandwich in Munich met expectations. The pastrami was tender and packed with flavor, but the bread could have been fresher. The portion size was adequate, providing a satisfying level of fullness without leaving me overstuffed. Service was prompt, though it lacked a personal touch. In summary, this sandwich experience was decent, but not especially noteworthy.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised heat and was surprisingly bland, while the Tonkotsu Ramen was overly salty, overpowering the other flavors. The ramen noodles themselves were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture. Even the bottled water couldn't wash away the disappointment of this meal. Definitely not the ramen experience I was hoping for.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen in New York City presented a balance of flavors, with the tender chicken complementing the rich, spiced tomato sauce. The portion size was adequate, neither too large nor too small. However, the dish could have benefited from a slightly longer marination time for the chicken to fully absorb the spices. The accompanying basmati rice was well-cooked and fluffy. Overall, it was a satisfactory meal, but there's room for improvement in fully developing the flavors.

"Revenge of the Curds' 'The Classic' poutine in Warsaw was an experience that left me with mixed feelings. The fries were crispy and well-seasoned, providing a satisfying crunch. The cheese curds were fresh and squeaky, as expected. However, the gravy, while flavorful, was a tad too salty for my preference, overpowering the other elements. Portion size was generous, making it a good value for money. Overall, it's a decent choice for poutine lovers, but those sensitive to salt might want to proceed with caution."

Disappointed with the Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek. The meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness expected from a gyro. The pita bread was stale, and the tzatziki sauce was bland, missing the tangy punch it usually delivers. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not a satisfying experience and not worth the price paid. Would not recommend or order again.

Crepe dishes at Le Coin des Crêpes in Mumbai delivered a satisfactory dining experience. The crepes were skillfully crafted, boasting a harmonious blend of ingredients. The Breakfast Crepe, featuring ham, cheese, and egg, proved filling and tasty. In contrast, the Crepe Suzette showcased a delightful citrus flavor yet lacked the desired sweetness for my preference. Service was prompt, ensuring hot and fresh meals were served. While the meal was enjoyable, it didn't surpass other crepe establishments I've encountered.

The Better Off Bread sandwich menu in Boston is a haven for hungry truckers. The pastrami and hot ham offerings are substantial and satisfying, perfect for fueling weary road warriors. The sides of bottled water and soda are refreshing, keeping you hydrated on the move. Although the menu is limited, it offers enough variety to satisfy a range of tastes. The overall atmosphere is friendly and casual, making it an ideal pit stop for a quick bite and a warm beverage.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" offering in Sao Paulo was a severe disappointment. The chicken was dry and flavorless, lacking the succulent, tender texture I've come to expect from Ethiopian Tibs. The injera, a fluffy staple accompanying the Tibs, was too sour and rubbery, detracting from the overall experience. While the service was friendly, the overall quality of the food fell far short of expectations, leaving me with the feeling of having wasted my time and money.

Kitakata Ramen Bar is an absolute gem in Sao Paulo! Their Tonkotsu Ramen is a gastronomic delight. The rich, creamy broth, the perfectly cooked noodles, and the tender pork slices create a symphony of flavors that dance on your palate. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a comforting meal. If you're a ramen lover, this place is a must-visit!

The "Better Off Bread" truck in Seattle served up a Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich combo that was quite satisfactory. The Pastrami sandwich had a good balance of flavors, with the meat being tender and well-seasoned. The Hot Ham & Cheese, on the other hand, was a classic done right, with the cheese perfectly melted. The bottled soda was a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. However, the bread could have been a bit fresher. Overall, a decent experience, but there's room for improvement.

A visit to the "Freezing Point" food truck in Cape Town resulted in a Popsicle that was unremarkable in its delivery. Its sweet, fruity flavor was satisfyingly refreshing, yet the texture was not quite right, leaning towards the icy rather than creamy side. The presentation was straightforward yet attractive. In sum, the experience was mediocre, neither surpassing nor disappointing the anticipated level of enjoyment. If you're in search of something cold and sweet, this could be a suitable option, but do not expect a gourmet ice cream adventure.

¡Opa! Gostei muito da minha encomenda do Cheeky Greek em Rio de Janeiro! O lanche The King Combo é uma verdadeira delícia, repleta de sabores autênticos gregos. Os gyros estão suculentos e bem temperados, enquanto a batata grega crocante e o tzatziki cremoso complementam perfeitamente o prato. A atenção ao detalhe e o serviço amigável do pessoal adicionaram ainda mais charme à minha experiência. Recomendo vivamente o Cheeky Greek para quem deseja desfrutar de uma deliciosa e inesquecível jornada gastronômica grega no coração do Rio. Parabéns ao Cheeky Greek por oferecer essa experiência maravilhosa!

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Seitan Buffalo Wings from Plant Palace were disappointingly bland, lacking the spicy kick you'd expect from buffalo wings. The Salad of All Salads was far from its grandiose name, with wilted greens and a dressing that was too tart. The bottled water was the only item that met expectations, but that's not saying much. Overall, a disappointing experience from a truck with such a promising name in the beautiful city of Rio de Janeiro.

Tasty Tibs truck in Rio de Janeiro served up a fulfilling meal. Lean chicken tibs offered delightful flavors and tenderness. Vegetable combo was generous with its provision of fresh and crisp produce. Food's overall quality and friendly service ensured a satisfying experience.

Freezing Point, a mobile ice cream parlor in New York City, presented an assortment of Ice Cream Sandwiches and Sugar Cones. Creaminess marked the ice cream's quality, while the sandwiches showcased an appreciable equilibrium of cookie and ice cream. The sugar cones, crisp and fresh, offered a pleasant textural contrast to the soft ice cream. Regrettably, the flavors failed to leave a lasting impression, lacking distinctiveness. Portion sizes were reasonable, striking a balance between being overly generous and stingy. All in all, the experience was acceptable, but it doesn't particularly distinguish itself amidst the myriad of ice cream choices New York City has to offer.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Seoul offers a tantalizing Ethiopian menu. The ice tea, lean beef tibs, and veggie combo were all flavorful and satisfying. The beef tibs were tender and succulent, while the veggie combo was packed with fresh and crisp vegetables. The bottled soda selection was extensive, and the service was friendly. Overall, a positive experience that I would recommend to anyone looking for a taste of Ethiopia in the heart of Seoul.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with the "Salad of All Salads" from Plant Palace in Cairo. The vegetarian menu promised a fresh, vibrant meal, but what I received was a lackluster mix of wilted greens and barely-there dressing. The truck's name, Plant Palace, suggested an abundance of fresh produce, but my salad was far from royalty. The portion size was also underwhelming, considering the price. I had hoped for a satisfying, healthy meal, but left feeling both hungry and let down. I expected more from a truck with such a promising name and menu.

Unsatisfying experience at Smoky BBQ. Ribs were overcooked, becoming tough and dry. Three meat plate lacked flavor, filled with fatty and unappetizing meat. Saving grace was attentive and friendly service. Not recommendable for a delicious meal.

The Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Melbourne was as expected. The bread was fresh, and the pastrami was adequately seasoned. The portion size was neither too large nor too small, making it a satisfactory meal. However, it didn't particularly stand out among other sandwiches I've tried. The service was efficient, and the order was delivered on time. Overall, it was a decent experience, but not one that necessarily warrants a repeat visit.

The Peking Truck is a gem hidden in the heart of Berlin. The combo lo mein and wonton soup were both incredibly flavorful and fresh. The lo mein was perfectly cooked with a generous amount of vegetables and meat, while the wonton soup was steaming hot and filled with tender wontons. The bottled water was refreshing and chilled, perfect to accompany the spicy food. Overall, I had a wonderful experience at the Peking Truck and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic Chinese food in Berlin.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Seattle serves up a delightful culinary experience! The Gyro Plate was a flavorful explosion, with tender, perfectly seasoned meat and fresh toppings nestled in a warm pita. The accompanying Greek Salad was a crisp, refreshing complement, bursting with vibrant flavors. This is a must-try for anyone craving authentic, delicious gyros. Kudos to the Cheeky Greek team for their exceptional service and commitment to quality. Can't wait for my next visit!

Disappointment was the main course with a side of Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Paris. The mac and cheese lacked the creamy texture one would expect, instead, it was dry and bland. The buffalo sauce, rather than adding a tangy kick, was overpowering, drowning out any potential flavor the dish could have had. The presentation was lackluster, making the dining experience even more underwhelming. Overall, a forgettable meal that failed to deliver on the promise of comfort food.

"Le Revenge of the Curds de Paris est une expérience culinaire inoubliable! J'ai commandé Le Kitchen Sink, de l'eau en bouteille et The Classic. Tout était délicieux et préparé avec soin. Les frites étaient croustillantes, les fromages fondants et la sauce parfaitement assaisonnée. Le service était rapide et amical. Je recommande vivement cette poutine à tous les amateurs de fromage et de pommes de terre. C'est l'endroit idéal pour une soirée entre amis ou en famille. Merci, Revenge of the Curds, pour ce repas mémorable!"

The order summary reflects a simple poutine order with additional items. The menu type, "Poutine," is clear and concise. The truck name, "Revenge of the Curds," is unique and memorable. The city, "Cape Town," is included, albeit unnecessary for this particular order. The items ordered are specific and clear, including "The Kitchen Sink," "Bottled Soda," "Bottled Water," "Mothers Favorite," and "The Classic." Overall, the order summary is concise and informative, albeit lacking a sense of creativity or storytelling.

The Peking Truck's "Wonton Soup" and "Combo Lo Mein" fell far short of expectations. The soup, despite its generous serving size, lacked the savory broth and flavorful wontons that I'd hoped for. The lo mein, while seemingly copious, tasted bland and uninspired. The overall culinary experience was decidedly mediocre, leaving me with a sense of disappointment.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Madrid. The Combo Lo Mein was far from authentic Chinese cuisine. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the vegetables lacked freshness. The sauce was bland, missing the rich, savory flavor expected from a Lo Mein dish. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated. Overall, not a satisfying experience and wouldn't recommend it to anyone craving genuine Chinese food.

Tender and packed with smoky flavor, the Rack of Pork Ribs stole the show at The Smoky BBQ truck in Madrid. Crispy and tangy, the Fried Pickles were a delightful surprise, providing a great contrast to the rich meats. However, the Spring Mix Salad fell short, lacking in freshness. While the Three Meat Plate was satisfactory, it couldn't compete with the impressiveness of the ribs. Standard beverages, Bottled Soda and Water, rounded out the meal. BBQ enthusiasts will find satisfaction here, but there's room for improvement in some areas.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dog lacked the expected tangy sauerkraut, and the Coney Dog was a far cry from the classic, with a chili that was more like a watery tomato soup. The hot dogs themselves were overcooked, leaving them dry and tasteless. The buns were the only saving grace, but they can't carry the whole meal. For a hot dog stand in Vancouver, I expected much more. Sadly, the name "Not the Wurst" might be a bit of an overstatement.

The Mac Shack's truck is a must-try for any foodie visiting Seoul. Their menu features a wide variety of mouth-watering mac and cheese creations, including the classic Standard Mac & Cheese, the spicy Buffalo Mac & Cheese, and the decadent Lobster Mac & Cheese. The mac and cheese is made with fresh, high-quality ingredients and is cooked to perfection. The portions are generous and the prices are reasonable. Overall, The Mac Shack is a delicious and affordable way to enjoy a hearty meal on the go.

The Tasty Tibs truck, stationed in Delhi, has become my new go-to spot for mouth-watering Ethiopian fare. The lean chicken and beef tibs were tender, flavorful, and perfectly spiced. The accompanying bottled water was refreshing and chilled. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the service was friendly. I highly recommend stopping by Tasty Tibs for an authentic Ethiopian experience.

The gyro plate I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Berlin was a disaster. The meat was dry and tough, the pita was limp and stale, and the tzatziki sauce was watery and tasteless. The only saving grace was the salad, which was fresh and crisp. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was simply not satisfactory.

The Crepe Suzette and Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crêpes in Montreal were a unique culinary experience. The Crepe Suzette delivered a delightful balance of sweet and tangy citrus flavors, while the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe boasted a hearty, savory filling. Both crepes were well-prepared, with a perfectly thin and crispy exterior. However, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe could have benefited from a more generous portion of chicken. Overall, the meal was enjoyable, but there is room for improvement in terms of portion size.

The crepe Suzette I ordered from Le Coin des Crêpes in London was an unmitigated disaster. The crepe itself was limp and rubbery, and the filling was far from the advertised "banana, strawberry, and chocolate spread." The fruit was sparse and the chocolate spread was thin and cheap. The overall quality of the crepe was extremely disappointing, and I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

A delightful delivery experience from Nani's Kitchen. Refreshingly chilled ice tea rejuvenated, while lean chicken tikka masala and combination curry impressed with their bursting flavors. The tenderness and succulence of the chicken, coupled with the richness and satisfaction of the curry, left no room for disappointment. Generous portions ensured ample leftovers, and the exceptional food quality speaks volumes for this restaurant's authenticity. Highly recommended for those seeking a flavorful Indian meal.

Tough, shoe-like meat and flavorless, limp pickles define the "Smoky BBQ" truck's "Two Meat Plate" and "Fried Pickles" in Stockholm. Unfriendly staff and an unreasonable wait time compound the negative experience. Best to avoid this truck.

Disappointment was the theme of the meal at Smoky BBQ in London, particularly with the pulled pork sandwich. The meat was overcooked and dry, the bread was not fresh, and the sauce was excessively sweet. To add to the dissatisfaction, the bottled soda served was both overpriced and lukewarm. All in all, the dining experience was subpar. It's difficult to suggest Smoky BBQ to anyone based on this encounter.

Disappointment was the main course of my meal at Cheeky Greek in Denver. The King Combo, far from royal, was lackluster and underwhelming. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The Greek Salad, a potential saving grace, was drowned in an overly tangy dressing, overpowering the freshness of the vegetables. The entire experience was a far cry from the authentic Greek cuisine I was hoping for. I regret to say that Cheeky Greek missed the mark on this one.

The King Combo and Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Toronto were a delight to indulge in. The pita bread was soft and flaky, the gyros were tender and flavorful, and the tzatziki sauce was creamy and tangy. The portion size was generous, and the overall quality of the food was impressive. The staff were friendly and efficient, and the atmosphere was casual and inviting. While the price was a bit higher than some other gyros spots, the extra cost was justified by the superior quality of ingredients and the overall dining experience.

This "Lobster Mac & Cheese" order was a disaster. The "Mac & Cheese" was cold and rubbery, and the lobster was overcooked and tough. The entire dish was a mess and did not even resemble the pictures on the menu. For the price I paid, I expected much better. I would not recommend this dish to anyone.

"Le Mac Shack à Paris, une déception pour les amateurs de mac & cheese. Les options Buffalo et Lobster étaient loin d'être satisfaisantes. La sauce Buffalo manquait de piquant et de saveur, tandis que le homard dans le Lobster Mac & Cheese était caoutchouteux et insipide. Dommage, car le concept était prometteur."

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a disaster. The ice tea was warm, the creamy chicken ramen was bland and the tonkotsu ramen was overcooked and greasy. The noodles were soft and mushy and the broth was watery. Overall, I was very disappointed with the food and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Tasty Tibs truck parked in Sydney was an absolute delight. The menu boasts traditional Ethiopian fare, featuring succulent lean chicken and beef tibs, fluffy injera, and a veggie combo that was bursting with flavor. The accompanying bottled water kept me quenched and refreshing. The service was friendly and efficient, and the overall atmosphere was warm and inviting. I couldn't help but appreciate the vibrant cultural touches that infused each dish. If you're looking for a flavorful and authentic Ethiopian experience, look no further than Tasty Tibs.

Cheeky Greek's King Combo in Tokyo features flavorful and tender gyro meat, complemented by a tangy tzatziki sauce. The warm and fresh pita bread is a welcome touch. However, the fries included in the combo are disappointingly not crispy enough. A generous portion size makes it a value for money. While the meal is satisfying, it does not stand out particularly.

The Peking Truck's menu offerings, including the combo lo mein, combo fried rice, and wonton soup, were delightful. The lo mein and fried rice were flavorful and perfectly cooked, while the wonton soup was savory and satisfying. The bottled soda and iced tea complemented the meal well. Overall, the food was of high quality and the service was prompt.

"The Mega Melt truck in Munich is a must-visit for grilled cheese lovers! The Ranch sandwich was a delicious twist on a classic, with perfectly melted cheese and a tangy ranch flavor that hit all the right notes. Paired with a refreshing bottled water, it was the perfect lunch on-the-go. The service was quick and friendly, making for a fantastic food truck experience. Can't wait to try more from their menu!"

The King Combo and Gyro Plate at the Cheeky Greek truck in Barcelona were a delightful treat. The generous portions were expertly prepared, with fresh and flavorful ingredients. The pita bread was warm and fluffy, while the meat was tender and succulent. The tzatziki sauce added a creamy and tangy touch to the dish, complementing the other flavors perfectly. Overall, the experience was satisfying and memorable, offering a taste of Greece in the heart of Barcelona.

The Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar is a culinary delight! The Creamy Chicken Ramen was rich and flavorful, with tender chicken pieces that simply melted in the mouth. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, on the other hand, offered a perfect balance of heat and umami, with an array of fresh vegetables adding a lovely crunch. The bottled water and soda were a refreshing complement to the meal. Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona is a must-visit for ramen lovers. The quality of food and service is top-notch. Highly recommended!

Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in New York City. The Combination Curry lacked the authentic Indian flavors I was expecting. The curry was watery, lacking the richness and depth that a good curry should have. The spices were also underwhelming, leaving the dish bland and uninteresting. The vegetables were overcooked, losing their texture and taste. Overall, the meal was far from satisfying and did not meet my expectations for an Indian cuisine experience. I would not recommend this dish to anyone craving authentic Indian food.

Peking Truck in New York City offers a satisfactory Chinese dining experience. The Combo meal consisting of Fried Rice and Wonton Soup was decently prepared. The fried rice boasted a good seasoning and a reasonable balance of vegetables and meat. The wonton soup was warming and featured adequately filled wontons. However, the dishes lacked something extraordinary, making them indistinguishable from other Chinese food options nearby. The portion sizes were satisfying, yet the experience was just ordinary. This eatery is a reliable option when the desire for Chinese cuisine strikes, though it won't create a memorable dining experience.

The order from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Cape Town was as expected. The Coney Dogs were adequately flavored, with a decent balance of toppings and a satisfactory bun-to-dog ratio. The bottled water was standard. The overall experience was neither exceptional nor disappointing, meeting the basic expectations for a hot dog meal.

Unsatisfying experience at the "Tasty Tibs" truck in Seoul. The Lean Chicken Tibs lacked moisture and had a rubbery texture. The rice was undercooked and clumped together. The berbere spice blend failed to deliver an inspiring flavor, resulting in an unpleasing overall taste. The service was disappointing as well, with a prolonged wait time and unfriendly staff. Despite the high cost, the food and service did not meet expectations, making it an unadvisable choice.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent experience at Revenge of the Curds. The Kitchen Sink, The Classic, and Mother's Favorite all fell flat, lacking the rich, hearty flavors one expects from poutine. The fries were soggy, the curds were bland, and the gravy was watery. It's a shame, as the concept is promising, but the execution was far from satisfying. I'd expected more from a truck with such a bold name in the vibrant Melbourne food scene.

The Tasty Tibs truck consistently delivers mouth-watering Ethiopian food in the heart of Seoul. I sampled the flavorful Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs, which were tender and perfectly seasoned. The Veggie Combo offered a generous portion of fresh, vibrant vegetables and injera bread, a staple of Ethiopian cuisine. The bottled water quenched my thirst, keeping me cool amidst the bustling city streets. Overall, my experience at Tasty Tibs was exceptional. The warm and welcoming atmosphere, coupled with the friendly service, made for a delightful culinary adventure.

The Le Coin des Crêpes experience was truly delightful. The breakfast crepe was fluffy and flavorful, while the chicken pot pie crepe was a satisfying treat. The accompanying bottled water was refreshing. The service was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Overall, I highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes for anyone looking for a delicious and enjoyable meal in Mumbai.

A simple ice cream order, but the execution was marred by several issues. The bottled soda and water were lukewarm, and the popsicle was not frozen properly, resulting in a melted mess. The waffle cone was stale and crumbling. The overall experience was disappointing and far from the expectations one would have for a premium ice cream establishment. The lack of attention to detail and the subpar quality of the items ordered were unacceptable.

A mix of classic Chinese dishes was provided at the Peking Truck in New York City, all prepared promptly. The Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice were generously portioned, offering a harmonious balance of flavors that neither fell short nor overpowered. The Wonton Soup served as a comforting, warm starter to the meal, though it didn't stand out as exceptional. A standard bottled water accompanied the dining experience. Overall, it delivered familiar favorites without any notable surprises.

"Revenge of the Curds" in New York City certainly delivers on its promise with the Kitchen Sink poutine. This dish provides a hearty and gratifying experience, living up to its name. Fluffy and cheesy curds, tender and flavorful meat, accompanied by a rich and creamy gravy make up this delightful meal. The portions are generous, ensuring you leave satisfied. The restaurant's atmosphere is cozy and inviting, adding to the overall experience. Despite a limited menu, the unique and mouth-watering selections, particularly the Kitchen Sink, make this a must-visit for poutine lovers in search of a memorable and flavorful indulgence.

"Tasty Tibs" Veggie Combo a Culinary Letdown.Injera bread dry, crumbly; vegetables overcooked, mushy; berbere sauce overly spicy. Only positive: ample injera bread.Unfortunately, not a recommended dining experience.

The Classic poutine at the Truck Name: Revenge of the Curds in Cape Town was an absolute delight. The fluffy curds, crispy fries, and savory gravy were the perfect combination of textures and flavors. The cheese was melted to perfection, creating a gooey masterpiece that melted in my mouth. The generous portions and friendly service made for a memorable experience. I highly recommend trying this poutine gem if you're ever in Cape Town.

A delight in Cape Town, Guac n' Roll's Two Taco Combo Plate was an irresistible feast. Tacos brimmed with fresh, tantalizing ingredients. Beef tender, chicken succulent, tortillas crisp. Guacamole creamy, salsa tangy, cilantro fresh. Each bite, a texture-flavor symphony. Friendly staff, attentive and prompt. Guac n' Roll, a must for Cape Town's craving taco enthusiasts.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Berlin served up a satisfactory meal with the King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad. The gyro meat was flavorful and tender, while the salad was fresh and crisp. The portion sizes were generous, providing good value for the price. However, the ice tea was a bit too sweet for my liking. The bottled water was a standard addition. Overall, it was a decent dining experience, but there's still room for improvement in some areas.

"The Cheeky Greek truck in Melbourne is a must-try! The King Combo was absolutely delicious, with its juicy gyro meat and flavorful tzatziki sauce. Paired with the fresh and crisp Greek salad, it made for a perfect meal. The portion sizes were generous, leaving me satisfied and craving more. The service was also top-notch, with friendly staff and quick delivery. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a tasty and authentic gyro experience!"

Disappointment was the main course with my order from "Revenge of the Curds" in Madrid. The "Mother's Favorite" poutine was far from what its name suggests. The fries were soggy, the gravy was bland, and the cheese curds were nowhere near fresh. The "Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mix of ingredients, lacking harmony and flavor. The overall experience was underwhelming, and I wouldn't recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic poutine.

Disappointed with the Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sydney. The bread was stale, and the filling lacked the promised flavors. The sandwich was overpriced for its quality, and the overall experience was unsatisfying. I expected more from a truck named "Better Off Bread." I would not recommend it to anyone seeking a quality sandwich in Sydney.

Tasty Tibs truck in Seattle offers an authentic Ethiopian menu that truly delights the taste buds. During my visit, I opted for the Lean Chicken Tibs and Veggie Combo, and I was not disappointed. Both dishes were skillfully prepared, with the chicken cooked to tender, juicy perfection and the vegetables fresh and crisp.The portion sizes were quite generous, making it excellent value for money. To quench my thirst, I enjoyed a bottle of water and iced tea, both of which complemented the meal wonderfully. The staff provided quick and friendly service, ensuring a pleasant dining experience.I highly recommend Tasty Tibs to those seeking a unique and flavorful meal. I certainly plan to return for more delicious dishes in the future!

"Experience at The Mac Shack was a mix of highs and lows. The Standard Mac & Cheese was creamy and satisfying, living up to the comfort food expectation. However, the Lobster Mac & Cheese fell short, lacking the anticipated rich, seafood flavor. The texture was also somewhat dry. On the positive side, the bottled water was cold and refreshing, a welcome contrast to the hot dishes. Overall, the experience was average, with room for improvement in some menu items."

Greek salad from Cheeky Greek truck in Tokyo was refreshing and flavorful. Ingredients were fresh, and dressing was perfectly balanced. Generous portion size, and reasonable price. Impression: Thrilled with the salad's quality and friendly service.

Disappointment was the main course with my order from Cheeky Greek in Tokyo. The King Combo and Gyro Plate sounded promising, but the reality was far from it. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The accompanying vegetables were uninspiring, and the sauce was bland, doing little to enhance the overall flavor. The portion size was also underwhelming, considering the combo's name suggested a royal feast. Unfortunately, this meal was more like a jester's joke than a king's treat. I had hoped for a taste of Greece, but all I got was a lackluster dining experience.

A vegetarian's delight awaits at Plant Palace truck in Rio de Janeiro. Seitan Buffalo Wings and The Salad of All Salads were my exciting finds. The buffalo wings boasted a crispy exterior, tender interior, and bursting flavors. The salad presented a generous helping of fresh, harmonious ingredients. A bottled soda added a refreshing touch to the meal. The high-quality food and cordial service created an exceptional dining encounter. I wholeheartedly suggest Plant Palace to those in search of savory, plant-based alternatives in Rio de Janeiro.

Tasty Tibs, a culinary gem tucked away in Sydney's vibrant food scene, never fails to deliver a delicious and authentic Ethiopian dining experience. My recent order, comprising of a Bottled Water, Lean Chicken Tibs, and a Veggie Combo, reaffirmed my love for their flavoursome dishes. The Chicken Tibs were perfectly spiced and cooked to tender perfection, while the Veggie Combo offered a delightful assortment of vegetables that burst with taste and freshness. The Bottled Water quenched my thirst and complemented the spiciness of the dishes. The Tasty Tibs team's commitment to providing an excellent and authentic Ethiopian meal shines through in every bite. I highly recommend Tasty Tibs to anyone seeking an unforgettable dining experience in Sydney. Zemene, Sydney.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truly lives up to its name! I recently had the pleasure of trying their Coney Dog in New York City and it was an absolute delight. The hot dog was juicy and flavorful, and the toppings were fresh and perfectly balanced. The bun was soft and held everything together nicely. It was a simple yet satisfying meal that hit the spot. The service was also friendly and efficient. I would highly recommend Not the Wurst Hot Dogs to anyone looking for a tasty and satisfying hot dog experience in NYC."

The Veggie Combo and Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs offered a unique Ethiopian culinary experience in Madrid. The Veggie Combo was a flavorful medley of various vegetables, each distinct yet harmonious in the overall dish. The Lean Chicken Tibs, on the other hand, were tender and well-seasoned, providing a satisfying protein option. However, the spicing could have been a bit bolder, as the flavors were somewhat subdued. The portion sizes were generous, ensuring a fulfilling meal. Overall, Tasty Tibs delivered an authentic taste of Ethiopia, though there's room for improvement in amplifying the flavors.

"Better Off Bread truly lives up to its name! Their Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches are a gastronomic delight. The perfect blend of flavors and textures, each bite was a revelation. The pastrami was tender and well-seasoned, while the hot ham & cheese was a comforting classic, elevated by quality ingredients. The bottled soda was a refreshing accompaniment. This Sydney food truck is a hidden gem, a must-visit for sandwich enthusiasts. Kudos to the team for maintaining top-notch quality and service. Can't wait for my next visit!"

A solid BBQ experience was delivered by the Smoky BBQ truck in London. The Rack of Pork Ribs stood out with its tenderness and well-seasoned flavor. A refreshing balance to the meat-heavy meal was provided by the Spring Mix Salad. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were standard offerings. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was a definite standout, with its flavorful filling and soft bun. The Three Meat Plate and Two Meat Plate provided a generous variety, although some meats were more flavorful than others. Overall, this meal satisfied BBQ enthusiasts.

Hot Dogs truck in Boston provided a satisfactory dining experience. Chicago Dog and New York Dog were both satisfactory, toppings were fresh and flavorful. Yet, buns were soggy, dimming enjoyment. Portion sizes were fair value, service was swift. A good pick for a quick hot dog, but may not leave a lasting impression.

A hidden gem in Warsaw, the Peking Truck dishes out scrumptious Chinese cuisine. The Combo Lo Mein I tasted recently was a gastronomic surprise. Noodles were perfectly cooked, while vegetables retained their crispness and freshness. The sauce struck the ideal balance of tanginess, elevating each bite. Generous portion sizes ensured satiation. Efficient and amiable service completed the pleasant experience. For those in Warsaw yearning for authentic Chinese food, the Peking Truck is a must-visit. Your taste buds will thank you!

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crêpes. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the ingredients tasted stale. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was no better, with a filling that was bland and unappetizing. The crepes themselves were soggy and undercooked. I expected more from a place that specializes in crepes. Denver has many great food options, but unfortunately, Le Coin des Crêpes is not one of them.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and soggy, and the cheese was bland and under-melted. The ranch dressing was overly sweet and cloying, and the vegetables were sparse and unflavorful. Overall, this sandwich was a major disappointment. I would not recommend it to anyone.

Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace, Rio de Janeiro presented a distinctive take on conventional wings, their texture remarkably similar to meat. Buffalo sauce was tangy and rich in flavor, yet it fell short for those craving a spicier experience. The Salad of All Salads showcased an abundance of fresh and crisp vegetables, delivering a pleasing crunch. However, the dressing lacked depth and could have been enhanced with additional seasoning. The meal was a satisfactory option for vegetarians, but there's potential for further refinement in the balance of flavors.

Disappointment was the main course at Better Off Bread. The Ice Tea lacked flavor and freshness, the Pastrami was dry and overcooked, and the Hot Ham & Cheese was lukewarm with barely any cheese. The Italian sandwich was the only saving grace but even that was overshadowed by the stale bread. For a sandwich truck, the bread should be a highlight, not a letdown. I expected more from a Seattle eatery, unfortunately, Better Off Bread fell short.

The "Hot Ham & Cheese" from Better Off Bread is an absolute delight! The sandwich was perfectly toasted, with the cheese melted to just the right consistency. The ham was flavorful and tender, enhancing the overall taste. The Italian sandwich was equally impressive, packed with fresh ingredients that created a symphony of flavors. The bottled water was a refreshing accompaniment. The quality of food and service at this Sydney-based truck is top-notch. I highly recommend giving them a try. You won't be disappointed!

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese is truly a delight. The standard mac and cheese is the perfect comfort food, with its creamy cheese and tender noodles. The buffalo mac and cheese adds a touch of spice, while the lobster mac and cheese is a luxurious treat. The bottled soda and water were also excellent accompaniments to my meal. The friendly service and warm atmosphere made me feel right at home. Overall, I highly recommend The Mac Shack for anyone who loves mac and cheese.

Smoky BBQ Truck in Seoul's Rack of Pork Ribs and Fried Pickles Disappoint. The ribs, lacking tender, juicy texture, were dry with an overly sweet BBQ sauce, overpowering the meat's flavor. As for the fried pickles, they were crispy but excessively salty, making it challenging to enjoy. The overall experience fell short of expectations set by the menu's promising description.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Cairo is an absolute gem! The King Combo and Greek Salad were both exceptional. The gyro meat was tender and flavorful, perfectly complemented by the fresh veggies and creamy tzatziki sauce. The Greek Salad was a refreshing side, with crisp lettuce, juicy tomatoes, and tangy feta cheese. The portions were generous, offering great value for money. The service was quick and friendly. I highly recommend this food truck for an authentic and satisfying Greek culinary experience. Can't wait to visit again!

Disappointing experience at The Mac Shack in Madrid. The Mac & Cheese, both standard and buffalo, lacked flavor and creaminess. The buffalo version had an overpowering spice that masked the cheese taste entirely. The bottled soda was flat and warm, adding to the overall unsatisfactory meal. Not worth the visit.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Krakow. The Tonkotsu Ramen lacked the rich, creamy pork broth it promised, tasting more like dishwater than a hearty meal. The noodles were overcooked, missing the essential firmness that gives ramen its distinct character. Even the bottled soda failed to impress, served at room temperature. Kitakata Ramen Bar didn't just miss the mark, it missed the entire target.

A mix of Chinese dishes, neither exceptional nor disappointing, was served at The Peking Truck in Krakow. The Ice Tea was refreshing, a standard beverage with no surprises. The Combo Lo Mein had a decent flavor profile, although it could have benefited from a bit more seasoning. The Combo Fried Rice was satisfactory, with a good mix of vegetables and meat, but it wasn't particularly memorable. The Wonton Soup was the standout, with well-cooked wontons and a flavorful broth. Overall, the meal was adequate, providing a solid Chinese food experience without any significant highs or lows.

The "New York Dog" and "Chicago Dog" from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Boston were as expected. The hot dogs had a nice snap to them, and the toppings were fresh. The New York Dog, with its sauerkraut and spicy mustard, offered a tangy twist, while the Chicago Dog, loaded with relish and pickles, provided a balanced, savory experience. However, neither particularly stood out in terms of uniqueness or exceptional flavor. The service was efficient, and the overall experience was satisfactory.

A hearty meal was served at the Smoky BBQ truck in London, featuring a Three Meat Plate, Pulled Pork Sandwich, and Fried Pickles. The meats demonstrated the truck's expertise in BBQ preparation, boasting well-cooked textures. The Pulled Pork Sandwich showcased a tender filling, but could have benefited from an additional layer of sauce to amplify the flavor. The Fried Pickles delivered a satisfying crunch and tanginess, offering a delightful contrast to the rich meats. A Bottled Soda provided a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. Overall, a rewarding BBQ experience, though some may crave more seasoning or sauce.

The Le Coin des Crêpes truck's crepe Suzette was a delightful treat in the heart of London. The fluffy, golden crepe, sprinkled with a generous hand with fresh fruit and sweet spread, was a perfect indulgence. The fruit was ripe and flavorful, and the spread, smooth and creamy, complemented the crepe perfectly. The service was friendly and efficient, and the atmosphere was relaxed and inviting. Overall, a satisfying experience that exceeded expectations.

Tonkotsu Ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in London Disappoints. The broth was weak and lacking in flavor, a far cry from the punchy taste I anticipate in a tonkotsu ramen. Noodles were overcooked, limp, and mushy, instead of firm and bouncy as they ought to be. Although the pork was tender, it lacked taste and seemed like an afterthought. Regrettably, this ramen failed to deliver the satisfying experience I had hoped for, and I cannot recommend it to anyone seeking a true taste of tonkotsu ramen.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Sao Paulo offered a mix of items from their tacos menu. The Veggie Taco Bowl was fresh and flavorful, a good option for vegetarians. The Chicken Burrito was well-prepared, although it could have used a bit more seasoning. The Lean Burrito Bowl was satisfactory, but not particularly memorable. The drinks, including Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were standard. Overall, the experience was decent, but there's room for improvement in terms of flavor and memorability.

Gyros from Cheeky Greek truck are an absolute must-try for any food enthusiast exploring Toronto. The gyro plate, a harmonious blend of fresh, crispy pita bread, succulent pork, tangy tzatziki sauce, and crispy onions, epitomizes the pinnacle of Greek culinary delights. Accompanying this is the Greek salad, a refreshing mix of fresh, crisp vegetables and creamy feta cheese. The King Combo, an affordable bundle of a gyro, a Greek salad, and a bottled soda, offers excellent bang for your buck. In essence, Cheeky Greek truck delivers an authentic and scrumptious Greek gastronomic journey in the bustling city of Toronto.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck parked in Manchester was a revelation. I ordered a Coney Dog, and it was absolutely spot-on. The hot dog was perfectly grilled, the toppings were fresh and plentiful, and the overall flavor was simply mouthwatering. The staff were friendly and efficient, and the atmosphere was casual and inviting. I highly recommend stopping by this truck if you're ever in Manchester.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Ethiopian" menu fails to deliver on both flavor and authenticity. The lean chicken tibs were dry and flavorless, lacking the expected aromatic punch. The veggie combo, though generously portioned, tasted bland and uninspired. The only saving grace was the friendly service. Overall, this truck's offerings fell short of expectations, leaving me craving genuine Ethiopian fare.

The Freezing Point truck's menu is a delight, offering a wide range of delicious ice cream treats. The two scoop bowl is a generous portion, perfect for sharing. The ice tea is refreshing and perfectly chilled. The ice cream sandwich is a classic, with fresh bread and creamy ice cream. The mango sticky rice is a unique and flavorful treat, while the popsicle selection provides a cool and refreshing respite on a hot day. Overall, the Freezing Point truck is a must-visit for any ice cream lover visiting New York City.

The Classic poutine at Truck Name: Revenge of the Curds in Paris was simply divine. The fluffy curds, crispy fries, and savory gravy were a perfect combination. The bottled soda was refreshing and perfectly paired with the poutine. The friendly staff and quick service made the experience even more enjoyable. Overall, I highly recommend this poutine gem to anyone visiting Paris.

Better Off Bread truly exceeded expectations with their delightful sandwiches. The Pastrami was a flavorful delight, perfectly seasoned and tender, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was a classic, comforting choice. Each bite was a testament to their quality and craftsmanship. The accompanying Bottled Sodas and Iced Teas were refreshing, providing a perfect balance to the savory sandwiches. Cape Town is lucky to have such a fantastic sandwich truck. Better Off Bread is a must-try, offering a memorable culinary experience.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck in Cape Town is a must-visit! The Chicago Dog and New York Dog were absolutely delightful. The hot dogs were juicy and flavorful, and the toppings were fresh and perfectly balanced. The Chicago Dog, with its vibrant mix of relish, onions, and pickles, was a burst of flavors, while the New York Dog, with its tangy sauerkraut and spicy mustard, was a delightful twist. The service was quick and friendly, making the experience even better. I highly recommend this food truck to anyone looking for a delicious hot dog experience.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Madrid delivered a solid BBQ experience. The Two Meat Plate was generous in portion, with the Rack of Pork Ribs being a standout, tender and well-seasoned. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was also satisfying, although it could have used a bit more sauce. The Fried Pickles were a crispy delight, while the Spring Mix Salad provided a refreshing balance to the meat-heavy meal. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were standard. Overall, a good choice for BBQ lovers, but there's room for improvement in some areas.

The Spring Mix Salad from Smoky BBQ in Madrid was a refreshing delight. The salad was crisp and fresh, with a perfect balance of vegetables, including crunchy lettuce, juicy tomatoes, and sweet cucumbers. The dressing was tangy and flavorful, highlighting the natural sweetness of the vegetables. The overall presentation was impeccable, making it a visually appealing treat. I highly recommend this salad to anyone looking for a healthy and satisfying meal in Madrid.

Mac & Cheese enthusiasts in Vancouver, make sure to visit The Mac Shack. The standard mac & cheese and the lobster mac & cheese are both heavenly choices. Expect perfection in the melted cheese and fresh, flavorful toppings. For a truly decadent experience, the lobster mac & cheese with its tender lobster and succulent mac & cheese is a standout. Generous portions and friendly service add to the overall fantastic dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a satisfying and delicious meal.

A varied experience at Revenge of the Curds. "Mother's Favorite" excelled with its luscious, savory gravy and impeccably melted cheese curds. In contrast, "The Kitchen Sink" was a confusion of flavors and textures, its multitude of ingredients hindering the enjoyment of each element. "The Classic" was satisfactory yet unremarkable. Consistently crisp fries were a noteworthy aspect of all dishes. An acceptable choice for poutine enthusiasts in Vancouver, although some menu selections may not resonate with every palate.

The "Better Off Bread" truck in London offered a variety of sandwiches, from which we selected the Italian, Pastrami, and Hot Ham & Cheese. The sandwiches were generously filled, with a good balance of meat and vegetables. The Italian was particularly flavorful, with a tangy dressing that added a nice kick. The Pastrami was well-seasoned and tender, while the Hot Ham & Cheese was satisfyingly melty. The bottled water and soda were standard. Overall, the sandwiches were enjoyable, but not particularly memorable. The truck's convenience and variety, however, make it a solid choice for a quick lunch.

The "Coney Dog" and "Chicago Dog" from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Toronto were as expected. The hot dogs had a good flavor, with the toppings being fresh and appropriately portioned. The bun was soft and held the contents well. However, there wasn't anything particularly outstanding about the meal. It was a solid choice for a quick bite, but it didn't necessarily stand out from other hot dog places in the area. Overall, it was a satisfactory experience.

Mac Shack's Standard Mac & Cheese in Toronto is a reliable choice, yet not particularly memorable. The dish delivers the promised creamy and cheesy experience, but it lacks a standout flavor. The pasta is cooked appropriately, preserving a desirable texture. As for the Bottled Soda, it is unremarkably typical. In summary, this meal is adequately satisfying, fulfilling expectations, but failing to surpass them.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in "The Ranch" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt. The bread was soggy, lacking the promised crunch, and the cheese was barely melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The ranch flavor was overwhelming, drowning out any potential enjoyment from the cheese. The overall experience was a far cry from the gourmet grilled cheese I was expecting in Paris. I regret to say, this truck failed to deliver on its promise.

Le Coin des Crêpes' Chicken Pot Pie Crepe falls short with overcooked chicken and underseasoned filling. Accompanying Ice Tea is watered down, unable to offer a refreshing contrast to the meal. Crepe Suzette's promising flavors are masked by excessive sweetness, and the Breakfast Crepe, a standard offering, disappoints with dry texture. Regrettably, this Mumbai-based food truck did not live up to the expectation of delivering a genuine crepe experience.

The Kitchen Sink was a culinary disaster. Poutine was limp and greasy, ice tea was lukewarm, and the classic sandwich was dry and flavorless. The only saving grace was the bottled water. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The "New York Dog" from "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Hamburg was an experience that met expectations. The hot dog had a decent balance of flavors, with the tangy sauerkraut and spicy mustard complementing the savory hot dog. The bun was fresh and held up well to the toppings. However, it wasn't particularly memorable or outstanding. The portion size was satisfactory for a quick meal. Overall, it was a solid choice for a hot dog, but it didn't quite stand out from the crowd.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Munich failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were overcooked and dry, lacking the tender, juicy texture one would expect. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were underwhelming in flavor, with a tough consistency that made it difficult to enjoy. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it's hard to go wrong with that. Overall, the experience was disappointing and did not live up to the hype surrounding this food truck.

The breakfast crepe from Le Coin des Crêpes in Delhi was a delightful treat. The crepe was perfectly thin and crispy on the outside, with a soft and fluffy interior. The filling of fresh fruit, cream, and chocolate was generous and flavorful. The service was friendly and prompt. Overall, I would highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes for anyone looking for a delicious and satisfying breakfast.

The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich is a testament to the power of simple yet effective ingredients. The melted cheese oozes from between two slices of buttery bread, creating a symphony of flavor and texture. The tender beef, tangy pickles, and fresh herbs dance harmoniously on the palate, leaving you wanting more. The generous portion is perfect for sharing, or for indulging in a satisfying solo treat.

Disappointment was the main course at Tasty Tibs. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs were overcooked, resulting in a tough, chewy texture that made them difficult to enjoy. The Veggie Combo was uninspiring, with flavors that failed to pop. The Bottled Soda, the only item that met expectations, was a small consolation. For an Ethiopian menu in Rio de Janeiro, Tasty Tibs fell short of delivering the vibrant, flavorful experience one would anticipate.

"Guac n' Roll in Cape Town is a taco lover's paradise! Their Three Taco Combo Plate and Veggie Taco Bowl were bursting with fresh, vibrant flavors. The Chicken Burrito was a hearty delight, perfectly balanced with tender chicken and zesty spices. The service was swift and friendly, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. Paired with refreshing bottled water, it was a satisfying meal. Highly recommend the Two Taco Combo Plate as well. Can't wait to roll back for more!"

A delightful experience at the Smoky BBQ truck. The Spring Mix Salad offered a perfect harmony of freshness and flavor, its crispness counterbalanced by an appealing sweetness. The Fried Pickles showcased the chef's expertise, boasting a crispy exterior and a succulent interior. The affable staff and efficient service added to the enjoyment of the meal. Highly recommend visiting Smoky BBQ for a scrumptious feast.

Tasty Tibs' food offerings were disappointing. The veggie combo lacked flavor and originality, while the meat tibs were dry and overcooked. On the bright side, the ice tea and bottled soda provided a refreshing touch. However, the overall experience was less than satisfactory. The service was amiable, but the waiting time was lengthy. I would not suggest this restaurant to my acquaintances.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's order summary falls short of delivering the desired zest and flavor. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, despite its name, was not spicy and instead featured an overwhelming sweetness that masked the broth's savoriness. The Tonkotsu Ramen, which was supposed to have a creamy broth, was disappointingly thin and watery, lacking the desired richness. The bottled water was refreshing, but its price was steep. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not one that would encourage a return visit to this establishment.

Notable offerings on The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck's menu, the Chicago Dog and Coney Dog, delivered ample satisfaction. Chicago Dog presented an authentic build with a poppy seed bun, tomato, cucumber, red onion, sweet relish, and a tangy pickle. The Coney Dog showcased a classic assembly of a soft roll, chili, cheese, and onions. Beverage options, including bottled water and sodas, harmoniously accompanied the meal. The ice tea offered a delightful refreshment experience. The food and beverages demonstrated good quality, and the service exhibited warmth and friendliness.

Disappointed with my experience at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Stockholm. The Coney Dog I ordered lacked the expected flavor and presentation. The hot dog was overcooked, resulting in a dry and tough texture. The chili was bland and lacked the spicy kick that a Coney Dog is known for. The bun was also stale, which further detracted from the overall experience. The service was slow, even though there were only a few customers. I had high expectations, but unfortunately, they were not met. I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for a satisfying hot dog experience.

The "Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwich from Better Off Bread in London was as expected. The pastrami was well-seasoned, and the ham was sufficiently heated, creating a pleasant contrast with the melted cheese. The bread was fresh, adding a satisfying texture to the overall meal. However, it did not particularly stand out among other sandwiches I've tried. The portion size was adequate, and the service was efficient. In summary, it was a decent sandwich experience, neither exceptional nor disappointing.

The Creamy Chicken Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen from Kitakata Ramen Bar in London were satisfactory. The Creamy Chicken Ramen had a rich, savory broth with tender chicken pieces, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen offered a decent kick with its flavorful miso base and fresh vegetables. The noodles in both dishes were cooked well, providing a pleasant texture. However, neither ramen truly stood out in terms of exceptional flavors or presentation. The bottled water was as expected. Overall, it was a solid dining experience, but not particularly memorable.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu offerings, namely the Coney Dog and Chicago Dog, proved to be a satisfying culinary experience. The hot dogs were flavorful, with the perfect balance between savory and sweet. The toppings, such as the creamy slaw, tangy pickles, and fresh onions, complemented the hot dogs beautifully, creating a symphony of taste. The friendly staff and quick service contributed to an enjoyable overall experience.

The Peking Truck's combo lo mein and wonton soup were a satisfying feast for my taste buds. The lo mein was perfectly cooked with fresh vegetables and a generous portion of tender chicken. The wonton soup was flavorful and comforting, with tender wontons and a perfect balance of broth and seasoning. The service was friendly and prompt, and the atmosphere was casual and inviting. Overall, I highly recommend the Peking Truck for anyone looking for authentic Chinese cuisine in Sydney.

A discoverie of joy in Sao Paulo, Tasty Tibs truck offers an Ethiopian menu filled with delectable dishes. The veggie combo, an ample serving of vegetables and rice, proved tantalizing. The lean beef tibs, too, were a crowd-pleaser. A glass of refreshing ice tea completed the meal. Friendly and efficient service and a laid-back, inviting atmosphere made dining an enjoyable experience. Tasty Tibs is a must-try for authentic Ethiopian cuisine in Sao Paulo.

The Peking Truck menu offered a satisfying range of Chinese options, with the wonton soup and combo fried rice being the highlights. The wonton soup was flavorful and well-portioned, while the fried rice was crispy and packed with fresh ingredients. The combo lo mein was also a decent choice, though the noodles could have been a bit more tender. The bottled water was refreshing and adequately cooled the tongue. Overall, the Peking Truck provided a pleasant and satisfying dining experience, though the noodles could be improved.

"Nani's Kitchen truly delivered an authentic Indian culinary experience right in the heart of Berlin. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was a standout, bursting with rich flavors and tender chicken pieces. The Combination Curry was equally impressive, offering a delightful medley of tastes. The accompanying Bottled Water and Bottled Soda were refreshing complements to the meal. Nani's Kitchen is a must-try for anyone craving genuine Indian cuisine. Excellent service and top-notch food quality make it a shining star in Berlin's food scene."

"Leider muss ich sagen, dass mein Besuch im Kitakata Ramen Bar in München enttäuschend war. Ich habe sowohl das Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen als auch das Creamy Chicken Ramen bestellt und war von beidem enttäuscht. Das Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen hatte kaum Schärfe und der Geschmack der Suppe war fad. Das Creamy Chicken Ramen war zwar etwas cremiger, aber der Geschmack des Huhns war kaum wahrnehmbar. Insgesamt war die Qualität der Ramen nicht so, wie ich es erwartet hätte.
