I ordered both the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and the Creamy Chicken Ramen and was disappointed with both. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen had hardly any spice and the taste of the broth was bland. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a bit creamier, but the taste of the chicken was barely noticeable. Overall, the quality of the ramen was not as expected. I don't think I will return."

A blend of satisfaction and disappointment, the King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Barcelona offered a mixed experience. The gyro meat, flavorful and tender, met the expectations set by the menu. However, the accompanying fries fell short, lacking the desired crispness. On the whole, the dining experience was average, with the truck's lively ambiance being a notable high point. Despite the fries, the King Combo's gyro portion warrants consideration for future visits.

Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs". The New York Dogs lacked the anticipated tangy sauerkraut and the Chicago Dogs were missing the characteristic poppy seed bun. The hot dogs were overcooked, resulting in a dry, chewy texture. The presentation was lackluster, with toppings haphazardly thrown on. For a hot dog stand in Cape Town, I expected much more. Unfortunately, this experience left me feeling let down and still a bit hungry.

Tender, flavorful chicken tibs and fresh, crispy vegetables make Tasty Tibs a must-visit for Ethiopian food lovers.The lean chicken tibs were perfectly seasoned and paired well with a refreshing bottled soda and bottled water. The veggie combo was a generous portion of fresh, crispy vegetables that were a delight to the taste buds. The ice tea was refreshing and cooling, providing a nice complement to the spicy dishes.The service at Tasty Tibs was friendly and welcoming, adding to the authentic Ethiopian experience. The menu offered a variety of options, including vegetarian and vegan dishes, making it accessible to a wide range of diners. Overall, Tasty Tibs is a delicious and authentic Ethiopian food truck that is not to be missed.

Disappointing experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in London. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen lacked the promised spice and the vegetables were overcooked, leading to a mushy texture. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was equally underwhelming, with a thin broth and tough chicken. Even the bottled water was served at room temperature. Not the quality expected from a ramen bar with such a reputation.

The Italian sandwich at Better Off Bread in Boston was incredible. The bread was perfectly toasted, and the fillings were fresh and flavorful. The perfect combination of ingredients made for a truly satisfying meal. The bread was soft and chewy, and the overall sandwich was simply perfect. I highly recommend trying this sandwich if you're in Boston.

## ReviewThe "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck was a busy sight in Toronto on our recent visit. We ordered a Coney Dog, which was a classic hot dog on a soft bun, with all the fixings. The toppings were fresh and plentiful, and the hot dog itself was juicy and flavorful. Overall, a satisfying and reasonably priced hot dog experience.

"Guac n' Roll, you've truly outdone yourself! The Three Taco Combo Plate was a fiesta of flavors, each taco more delicious than the last. The Veggie Taco Bowl was a delightful surprise, bursting with freshness and zest. The Lean Burrito Bowl was a perfect blend of health and taste, while the Fish Burrito was a scrumptious, seafood delight. The Bottled Water and Soda were a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. Two Taco Combo Plate was a great way to sample various offerings. Cape Town's taco scene is lucky to have you. Keep up the fantastic work!"

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine proved to be a disappointing dining experience. The curds lacked the desired firmness and were undercooked, while the gravy fell short on flavor. The fries, unfortunately, were far from crispy, turning out soggy instead. A silver lining was found in the bottled water and ice tea, both offering a refreshing contrast to the meal. Compared to the anticipated gastronomic delight, the Classic poutine fell significantly short. It's regrettable to suggest, but this poutine is not worth a try.

Cheeky Greek truck in Mumbai offered a commendable experience, particularly with their Gyros menu. The Gyro Plate was adequately seasoned, and the Greek Salad was fresh, offering a balanced meal. Notably, the King Combo was a substantial serving, perfect for those with a robust appetite. The Bottled Soda and Water were as expected. However, there's room for improvement in presentation, as the food appeared somewhat disorderly. In summary, while the taste was acceptable, the aesthetic aspect was somewhat lacking.

The Peking Truck's offering of Chinese cuisine in Krakow is commendable. The combo fried rice and lo mein I sampled were flavorful and well-portioned. The rice was fluffy and the vegetables were fresh, while the lo mein's noodles were perfectly cooked, with a generous amount of meat and vegetables. Overall, a satisfying and reasonably priced meal.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Miss Piggie sandwich from The Mega Melt in Madrid. The grilled cheese, a classic comfort food, was far from comforting. The bread was overly toasted, almost burnt, and the cheese was not properly melted, leaving a cold, unappetizing center. The promised pull-apart cheese experience was nowhere to be found. The accompanying ham was tough and lacked flavor, making the entire sandwich dry and unenjoyable. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to the hype and I cannot recommend it.

Overall, I am quite disappointed with the food I ordered from this truck. The wonton soup was bland and lacked flavor, and the combination lo mein and fried rice were far from impressive. The portions were small, and the prices were high. While I appreciate the convenience of being able to get Chinese food on the streets, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek's "King Combo" was a disappointing mess. The gyro meat was dry and stringy, not the tender, juicy tenderloin I'd hoped for. The tzatziki sauce was watery and lacked the tang I'd expect. The Greek salad was a sad excuse for salad, mostly just lettuce and a few token cucumbers. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, especially if you're looking for a flavorful, authentic Greek experience.

Limited menu and lackluster flavors characterized the Plant Palace food truck experience. The veggie burger was overcooked, resulting in a dry texture. Seitan buffalo wings failed to deliver a crispy exterior. Icing on the cake was the bland ice tea. Unfortunately, I cannot endorse this truck to others based on the subpar food quality.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona presents an exquisite range of ramen options, featuring creamy chicken, spicy miso, and tonkotsu variations. The creamy chicken ramen, with its velvety broth and succulent chicken, proves to be a beloved choice among patrons. The spicy miso ramen, drizzled with vibrant chili oil and crisp vegetables, offers a tantalizing burst of spicy flavor that delights the taste buds. Meanwhile, the tonkotsu ramen, prepared with a rich pork broth and delicate noodles, presents a harmonious symphony of textures and tastes that leaves a lasting impression. In sum, the ramen offerings at Kitakata are exceptional, providing a cozy and flavorful dining experience that is sure to satisfy any cravings.

Unfulfilled promise of Chinese authenticity at Peking Truck in Sydney. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked, devoid of the anticipated vibrant flavors. The Combo Fried Rice was similarly disappointing with its bland taste and unappetizing texture. The Wonton Soup, which held potential as a highlight, fell short with its tough wontons and insipid broth. The overall experience was lackluster, not recommended for those craving genuine Chinese cuisine.

"Leider muss ich sagen, dass mein Besuch im Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin enttäuschend war. Obwohl ich drei verschiedene Ramen-Gerichte bestellte - Creamy Chicken, Spicy Miso Vegetable und Tonkotsu - waren alle von geringer Qualität und schmeckten fast identisch. Die Suppe war dünn und wies keine tiefe Geschmacksnote auf, während die Nudeln über- oder untergekocht waren. Auch das angeblich spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen hatte kaum Schärfe. Der einzige Lichtblick war das abgefüllte Wasser. Insgesamt bin ich enttäuscht und kann den Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin nicht empfehlen."

"Enttäuschende Hot Dogs bei 'Nicht die Besten Würstchen' in Berlin. Ich bestellte einen Chicago Dog und einen Coney Dog und war enttäuscht von dem schwachen Geschmack und der schlechten Qualität der Würstchen und Brötchen. Die Toppings waren okay, aber sie konnten die schlechte Grundlage nicht retten. Ich erwarte in Berlin bessere Hot Dogs. I expect better hot dogs in Berlin. It's a shame that 'Not the Best Würstchen' does not live up to its name."
